BasicDescription.Title: Through The Night
BasicDescription.Synopsis: With Jonathan Swain. Music includes, Ravel: String Quartet in F major; Francisco Guerrero: Prado verde y florido; and Mozart: Piano Concerto No.27 in B flat major (K.595).

BasicDescription.Title: Morning On 3
BasicDescription.Synopsis: With Penny Gore. Music includes, Grieg: Lyric Suite, Op.54; Telemann:Sonata for trumpet and strings in D; Mozart: Symphony No.33 in B flat, K.319; and Liszt: Les Preludes.

BasicDescription.Title: Composer Of The Week
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Billy Mayerl (1902-1959). The War And The Final Years: Mayerl's biographer, Professor Peter Dickinson, discusses the influence and interest in Mayerl's music. With Donald Macleod.

Billy Mayerl (1902-1959)
The War And The Final Years.
Donald Macleod looks at how the Second World War transformed Billy Mayerl's career, and how he changed direction.
Mayerl's biographer, Professor Peter Dickinson, discusses the influence and interest in Mayerl's music.
Fireside Fusiliers Slovak Radio Symphony Orchestra Gary Carpenter
Resting Richard Tauber (tenor)
The Big Top Winter Suite Eric Parkin (piano)
Caprinella Reginald Leopold (violin) Max Byfield (piano)
Moods In Contrast Phillip Dyson (piano) BBC Concert Orchestra Roderick Dunk
Filigree Billy Mayerl (piano)

BasicDescription.Title: CD Masters
BasicDescription.Synopsis: With Rob Cowan. Music includes, Bloch: Abodah; Salamone Rossi: Kaddish (Songs of Solomon); Mozart: Piano Concerto in E flat major, K.449; and Prokofiev: Piano Sonata No. 8, Op. 84.

With Rob Cowan.
Bloch: Abodah Yehudi Menuhin (violin) Hendrik Endt (piano)
Salamone Rossi: Kaddish (Songs of Solomon) Siena Ensemble
Mozart: Piano Concerto in E flat major, K.449 Hephzibah Menuhin (piano) Bath Festival Orchestra Conducted by Yehudi Menuhin

Prokofiev: Piano Sonata No. 8, Op. 84 Dmitri Bashkirov (piano)
Bach: Concerto for two violins & strings in D minor, BWV1043 Yehudi Menuhin and George Enescu (violins) Paris Symphony Orchestra Conducted by Pierre Monteux

BasicDescription.Title: Morning Performance
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Stephanie Hughes presents the last programme of highlights from this year's Mozartfest, including Mozart's String Quartet in C, K.465 played by the Mosaiques Quartet.

BasicDescription.Title: Lunchtime Concert
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Sean Rafferty presents a concert from Belfast, first broadcast in 2001. The NTL Studio at the Waterfront Hall resounds to the sound of Artur Pizarro and Stephen Coombs' concert grands.

Sean Rafferty presents a concert from Belfast, first broadcast in 2001. The NTL Studio at the Waterfront Hall resounds to the sound of Artur Pizarro and Stephen Coombs' concert grands.
Mozart-Busoni Overture: 'The Magic Flute' Fantasy in F minor for mechanical clock Duettino Concertante (finale of Piano Concerto K.459)
Saint-Saens Polonaise Op.77 Caprice Arabe Op.96 Scherzo Op.87

BasicDescription.Title: BBC Orchestras
BasicDescription.Synopsis: BBC Philharmonic. Great Orchestrators: Ravels brilliant 1922 reworking of Musorgsky's Pictures at an Exhibition secured his place in history as one of the greatest orchestrators of all time.

Presented by Sandy Burnett.
BBC Philharmonic. Great Orchestrators.
Ravel's brilliant 1922 reworking of Musorgsky's Pictures at an Exhibition secured his place in history as one of the greatest orchestrators of all time.
Today, the BBC Philharmonic revels in its kaleidoscopic splendour under the baton of Yan Pascal Tortelier, and Tortelier turns the tables with his own orchestration of Ravel's Piano Trio.
Ravel: Piano Trio in A minor Conducted by Yan Pascal Tortelier
Tchaikovsky: Piano Concerto no. 1 Musorgsky (orchestrated Ravel): Pictures at an Exhibition Simon Trpceski (piano) Conducted by Vassily Sinaisky

BasicDescription.Title: Making Tracks
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Music for younger listeners presented by CBBC's Angellica Bell and Adrian Dickson.

BasicDescription.Title: Jazz Legends
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Donald Byrd: Julian Joseph introduces recordings by American trumpeter Donald Byrd, including his 1960s recordings for the Blue Note label with Herbie Hancock and Pepper Adams.

Donald Byrd.
Julian Joseph introduces recordings by this American trumpeter in conversation with Byron Wallen. Byrd was a member of Art Blakey's Jazz Messengers in the 1950s, and went on to work with John Coltrane, Thelonious Monk, and Sonny Rollins.
Selections include his 1960s recordings for the Blue Note label with Herbie Hancock, and baritone saxophonist Pepper Adams.

BasicDescription.Title: In Tune
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Sean Rafferty presents a selection of music, news and reviews from the arts world. Email: in.tune@bbc.co.uk

BasicDescription.Title: Performance On 3
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Recorded last Saturday in The Bridgewater Hall, Manchester, the BBC Philharmonic accompanied by pianist Martin Roscoe and baritone Christopher Maltman, perform Brahms' Symphony No. 4.

Recorded last Saturday in The Bridgewater Hall, Manchester, the BBC Philharmonic accompanied by pianist Martin Roscoe and baritone Christopher Maltman, perform pieces by James MacMillan, Tom Ades, and Brahms.
James MacMillan: Britannia James MacMillan: The Berserking Tom Ades: Brahms Brahms: Symphony No. 4
Conducted by James MacMillan and Gunther Herbig.

BasicDescription.Title: Night Waves
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Paul Allen talks to William Styron, author of Sophie's Choice, on the eve of Trevor Nunn's and Simon Rattle's world premiere of the operatic version of the book at the Royal Opera House.

Paul Allen talks to William Styron, author of Sophie's Choice, a story about a concentration camp survivor and her terrible secret, on the eve of Trevor Nunn's and Simon Rattle's world premiere of the operatic version of the book at the Royal Opera House. Angelika Kirschschlager makes her London debut as the enigmatic Sophie.

BasicDescription.Title: Andy Kershaw
BasicDescription.Synopsis: More sounds from around the world, plus further highlights from the concert given earlier this year by Great British eccentric, Ivor Cutler.

BasicDescription.Title: Jazz On 3
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CD Round Up 2002: Jez Nelson, writer and broadcaster Kevin Le Gendre and Jon Newey, editor of Jazzwise magazine, pick their highlights of the year's jazz releases.

CD Round Up 2002.
With jazz lovers' Christmas wish list in mind, Jez Nelson presents the highlights of a year in recorded jazz. Joining Jez in the studio are writer and broadcaster Kevin Le Gendre, and editor of Jazzwise magazine Jon Newey, picking their highlights of 2002's releases.
From established names to some less well known players, and including the best recent releases, the programme proves this has been a healthy year for the music.
